thread.title: Storm Doris 'halts outdoor filming on Coronation Street' as Helen Flanagan and Brooke Vincent battle weather | Metro News
thread.title_full: Storm Doris 'halts outdoor filming on Coronation Street' as Helen Flanagan and Brooke Vincent battle weather | Metro News

author: Sarah Deen For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Storm Doris 'halts outdoor filming on Coronation Street' as Helen Flanagan and Brooke Vincent battle weather | Metro News

organizations.name: metro news follow us coronation street

text:
Follow us Coronation Street stars Helen Flanagan and Brooke Vincent battle bad weather as Storm Doris ‚Äòhalts filming outside‚Äô Sarah Deen for Metro.co.uk Thursday 23 Feb 2017 4:01 pm Helen Flanagan battles the bad weather as Coronation Street tries to film on location (Picture: Eleanor Barlow/PA) 
Storm Doris has impacted our trains and our roads, but its also messed up our telly. Ant and Dec: 'We're in talks about an SM:TV reunion for the 20th anniversary' 
Filming on Coronation Street was reportedly brought to a halt by the bad weather as its stars battled to get some scenes done. 
Storm Doris has hit the country bringing with it 90mph winds and heavy rainfall, which brought outside action on Corrie to a standstill. 
Stars Helen Flanagan and Brooke Vincent, who play Rosie and Sophie Webster, were papped filming on location as it totally chucked it down. 
The actresses sported huge hooded red waterproof coats for warmth as they waited around for work to resume. Helen rehearses on location (Picture: Eamonn and James Clarke) 
Filming was apparently cancelled for the day (Picture: Eamonn and James Clarke) 
With Helen dolled up to the nines as Rosie, her glam look surprisingly didn‚Äôt suffer from the wet weather. A post shared by Helen Flanagan (@hjgflanagan) on Feb 23, 2017 at 2:02am PST 
She definitely wasn‚Äôt dressed for it, as Brooke demonstrated. üê©üíó A post shared by Helen Flanagan (@hjgflanagan) on Feb 23, 2017 at 2:10am PST 
Shooting outside has been stopped and rescheduled for when the weather is less APOCALYPTIC.
